thread.title: 360-degree video: Step inside a DeLorean from the 'Back to the Future' trilogy
thread.title_full: 360-degree video: Step inside a DeLorean from the 'Back to the Future' trilogy

title: 360-degree video: Step inside a DeLorean from the 'Back to the Future' trilogy
text:
'Back to the Future' screenwriter Bob Gale sits inside a restored DeLorean. (Photo: Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY)
10 CONNECT 11 TWEET 4 LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Doc Brown and Marty McFly may be the main characters in the Back to the Future triology, but any conversation about the iconic films is bound to come around to the time machine. With its stainless steel finish and gull wing doors, the DeLorean DMC-12 is among the most memorable cars in film history.
Now, USA TODAY is giving you the chance to experience the Back to the Future time machine like never before – in fully spherical 360-degree video.
So, grab your Oculus Rift, Samsung Gear VR, Cardboard or any other virtual reality headset and immerse yourself inside the DeLorean. Don’t have a headset, no problem! Just use your mouse, click and hold, to move around the scene on your computer screen.
Back to the Future screenwriter Bob Gale shows you the inside of the time machine and takes you for a ride around Universal Studio’s Courthouse Square – the same location where many of Back to the Future’s scenes were shot.
As you watch the video, keep in mind these three facts about the Back to the Future DeLorean:
1. A total of seven DeLoreans (including one fiberglass replica) were used in the filming of the Back to the Future trilogy.
2. On cold nights during filming, crews had to heat the DeLorean's gull wing door struts with hair dryers to keep the doors from falling closed.
3. The DeLorean's speedometer only actually goes up to 80 miles per hour. So the film crew added an extra speedometer on the dashboard to show the car's speed rising to 88 m.p.h., which is what is seen in the films. Why 88 m.p.h.? "No particular reason," Gale said. "It's really easy to remember."

9 of 22 GREAT SCOTT! 30 YEARS LATER, WE'RE 'BACK TO THE FUTURE' We've reached the future of 'Back to the Future' | 02:14 We are living in the future as imagined in "Back to the Future Part II." Well, sort of. We're still waiting on those flying cars. Video provided by Newsy Newslook
10 of 22 GREAT SCOTT! 30 YEARS LATER, WE'RE 'BACK TO THE FUTURE' Trailer: 'Jaws 19' | 01:21 The creators of 'Back to the Future' have released a fictional trailer for the film 'Jaws 19,' which was mentioned in "Back to the Future: Part 2". VPC
11 of 22 GREAT SCOTT! 30 YEARS LATER, WE'RE 'BACK TO THE FUTURE' 'Back to the Future Part II' got this right about 2015 | 01:50 The 2015 Marty McFly experienced in 'Back to the Future Part II' is quite different from the world we live in today, but the 1985 film got some predictions right. KUSA
12 of 22 GREAT SCOTT! 30 YEARS LATER, WE'RE 'BACK TO THE FUTURE' Nike to make 'Back to the Future' self-tying power laces | 01:29 Just like Marty McFly saw in 1989's Back to the Future Part II, Nike will produce self-tying power laces in 2015. Shannon Rae Green, USA TODAY
13 of 22 GREAT SCOTT! 30 YEARS LATER, WE'RE 'BACK TO THE FUTURE' 'Back to the Future' hoverboard really floats | 01:30 A California startup has designed what's considered to be the first real consumer hoverboard. As AP's Haven Daley reports, the floating board was inspired by the fictional gadget in the film "Back to the Future." (Nov. 12) AP
14 of 22 GREAT SCOTT! 30 YEARS LATER, WE'RE 'BACK TO THE FUTURE' Kickstarter campaign for real-life hoverboards | 01:01 Hendo Hover launched a KickStarter campaign to fund the world's first real hoverboard. Video provided by Buzz60 Newslook
15 of 22 GREAT SCOTT! 30 YEARS LATER, WE'RE 'BACK TO THE FUTURE' What 'Back to the Future II' got right about 2015 | 01:07 'Back to the Future II' made some bold predictions about what the year 2015 would be like. Now that it's here, Mara Montalbano (@maramontalbano) shows us what the movie got right. Video provided by Buzz60 Newslook
16 of 22 GREAT SCOTT! 30 YEARS LATER, WE'RE 'BACK TO THE FUTURE' Doc Brown comes 'Back to the Future' for all new short in trilogy's 30th anniversary re-issue | 01:10 Every 80's kids' favorite mad scientist will come 'Back to the Future' to appear in a new short called 'Doc Brown Saves the World'. As Mara Montalbano (@maramontalbano) tells us, it's part of the films' 30th anniversary DVD/Blue Ray re-issue. Buzz60
17 of 22 GREAT SCOTT! 30 YEARS LATER, WE'RE 'BACK TO THE FUTURE' Stars find their way 'Back to the Future' | 02:20 'Back to the Future' stars, Christopher Lloyd and Lea Thompson, attend the largest screening of the film to celebrate its 30th anniversary; with a score performed live by the Los Angeles Philharmonic conducted by David Newman. (July 1) AP
18 of 22 GREAT SCOTT! 30 YEARS LATER, WE'RE 'BACK TO THE FUTURE' Introducing the world's first working hoverboard | 01:18 "Back to the Future" fans are in for a treat, with Lexus showing off the world's first fully-functional hoverboard. But if you're hoping to buy one, you're in for a long wait. Bloomberg
19 of 22 GREAT SCOTT! 30 YEARS LATER, WE'RE 'BACK TO THE FUTURE' World record set for longest hoverboard ride | 01:10 Back to the future, here we come! The Guinness World Record has been set for farthest journey by hoverboard. Sean Dowling (@SeanDowlingTV) has the video you have to see. Buzz60
20 of 22 GREAT SCOTT! 30 YEARS LATER, WE'RE 'BACK TO THE FUTURE' Museum giving away DeLorean if Chicago Cubs win 2015 World Series | 01:07 'Back to the Future Part II' predicted the Chicago Cubs would win the 2015 World Series. Volo Auto Museum will give a way a DeLorean if they actually pull it off. Gillian Pensavalle (@GillianWithaG) has the details. Video provided by Buzz60 Newslook
21 of 22 GREAT SCOTT! 30 YEARS LATER, WE'RE 'BACK TO THE FUTURE' Buy your very own DeLorean for only $45,000 | 01:30 A Houston company is offering 'Back to the Future' fans a chance to own their very own DeLorean. The price for a screen-accurate version will run you about $45,000. VPC
